questions.question: 1. The cost, in dollars, to paint a room that has an area to be painted of A square feet is 0.75A + 20h, where h is the number of hours it takes to paint the room. What is the cost of painting a room that has an area to be painted of 120 square feet and takes 2 hours to paint?
2. What is the least common denominator of the fractions，, and ?

3. Malik is building a frame for a rectangular picture that he painted, and he needs to know the perimeter of the picture. The length of the picture is 36 inches and the width is 24 inches. What is the perimeter in inches, of the picture?
4. In △ABC the sum of the measures of ∠A and ∠B is 64°. What is the measure of ∠C ?
5. On  a map,  inch represents 10 miles. How many inches on this map represent 250 miles?
6. The 2 cubes shown below have diagonals AB and CD , respectively. The side lengths given are in feet. What is the ratio of the length of AB to the length of CD ?
7. What is the value of -x + y+ z for x = -1, y = -3, and z=2 ?
8. If 9 + 3x = 27, then 2x = ?

9. A woman purchased 100 shares of stock at $5.00 per share. If each share rose $0.10 the first month, decreased $0.08 the second month, and gained $0.03 the third month, what is the value of the woman’s investment?

10. At Acme Manufacturing Company, each employee’s annual salary for next year will be more than this year’s annual salary. An employee whose annual salary this year is $32,000.00 will have what annual salary next year?

11. Vat 1, Vat 2, and Vat 3, when full, each hold the same amount of water. At the present time, Vat 1 is  full, Vat 2 is full, and Vat 3 is  full. Water will be transferred between the vats so that each of the 3 vats contains the same amount of water. After the transfer, each of the 3 vats will be what fraction full?
12. Which of the following graphs shows the solution set for the inequality 4x - 2 ≥ 6 ？

13. The Hope-A-Lot Foundation is mailing brochures to 4,000 prospective donors. The foundation’s goal is to have proceeds of $1,500 after paying $900 for the mailing. According to past mailings, the average donation was $20 per donor. Assuming this average, how many of the prospective donors need to donate to reach the goal?

16. If Kusum uses 1 pound of grass seed per 800 square feet to be seeded, how many pounds of grass seed will she use to seed the region shown below?

17. Use the following information to answer questions 17-20.An organization promoting good nutritional habits collected data on fat calories in foods from 9 fast-food restaurants in Mesa City. The values in the list below represent the number of fat calories in a small order of french fries at each of these fast-food restaurants.                             160 , 106, 104, 113, 160, 103, 161, 89, 96 17. Based on the data listed, what is the median number of fat calories in a small order of french fries at these 9 restaurants?

The values in the list below represent the number of fat calories in a small order of french fries at each of these fast-food restaurants.                             160 , 106, 104, 113, 160, 103, 161, 89, 96 19. At Henry’s, 43% of the total number of calories in french fries are fat calories. Which of the following values is closest to the total number of calories in a small order of Henry’s french fries?

20. Use the following information to answer questions 17-20.An organization promoting good nutritional habits collected data on fat calories in foods from 9 fast-food restaurants in Mesa City. The values in the list below represent the number of fat calories in a small order of french fries at each of these fast-food restaurants.                             160 , 106, 104, 113, 160, 103, 161, 89, 96 20. Which of the following expressions gives the average of this larger list of values?

27. Avari traveled the 2-mile trail from her house to Big Lake on her bicycle. She then traveled 3 times around the Big Lake Loop and returned home by the 2-mile trail. At the end of her bicycle ride, the trip odometer showed that she had traveled 22 miles. Which of the following equations, when solved, gives the distance Avari traveled once around Big Lake Loop, d miles?

35. A circle in the standard (x, y) coordinate plane has its center at (-2, 4) and passes through (3, 16). What is the area, in square coordinate units, of this circle?

To the nearest foot, how many feet of garden fence will enclose the flower bed?

42. Circle P has a radius of 4 units and is in the standard (x, y) coordinate plane. The set of all points in the coordinate plane that are 3 units from the center of Circle P is a circle that：

choices.B: is internally tangent to Circle P.
choices.C: is externally tangent to Circle P.
choices.D: is interior to and does not intersect Circle P.
choices.E: is exterior to and does not intersect Circle P.

questions.question: 43. Suppose that x is a positive real number and is a rational number. Which of the following statements about x must be true?

46. Carmen drove from Blairtown to Ore City, a distance of 80 miles. From Ore City she drove on to Janesville, and then drove back to Blairtown. The ratio of Carmen’s driving times on the first, second, and third segments of the trip, respectively, was 5:2:4, and she drove at the same average speed on each segment. What was Carmen’s total driving distance, in miles, for the 3 segments of the trip?
